subject: Programming
title: The Turing Machine
description: Learn The Turing Machine in one minute.

hook.text: In 1936, Alan Turing imagined the simplest possible machine that could compute anything.

buildup.text: His theoretical machine has an infinite tape, a read/write head, and a set of rules.

discovery.text: Despite its simplicity, a Turing machine can compute anything any modern computer can.

twist.text: Your laptop is no more powerful than Turing's paper design. It's just faster.

climax.text: If a Turing machine can't solve a problem, no computer ever built will solve it either.

punchline.text: A paper machine from 1936 defines all computation.

quiz.question: What can a Turing machine compute?
